title: 113_s2796
content: The "Working Student Act of 2014" is a legislation that provides support for working students. The legislation amends income protection allowances for dependent and independent students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for the academic year 2015-2016. The legislation updates income protection allowances for dependent and independent students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for the academic year 2015-2016. The income protection allowance amounts are specified for different categories of students. The legislation updates income protection allowances for dependent and independent students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for the academic year 2015-2016. Family size and number of college students determine the income protection allowance amounts. The legislation updates income protection allowances for dependent and independent students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for the academic year 2015-2016. Family size and number of college students determine the income protection allowance amounts. The income protection allowances for different family sizes and number of college students are as follows: $30,078, $34,114, $37,665, and an additional $6,000 for each additional college student. The legislation updates income protection allowances for dependent and independent students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for academic years after 2015-2016. The Secretary will publish revised tables of income protection allowances in the Federal Register, with specific guidelines for independent students. The legislation updates income protection allowances for dependent and independent students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for academic years after 2015-2016. The Secretary will adjust the dollar amounts in the table of income protection allowances based on the estimated percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index. The legislation updates income protection allowances for students under the Higher Education Act of 1965 based on the Consumer Price Index. The amendments will be effective on July 1, 2015.
